transportAdvice: The lake towns are connected by a reliable network of ferries, local buses, and trains, making it practical to explore multiple villages without a car. Walking is feasible within individual towns, though the steep terrain and narrow roads can be challenging; taxis and water taxis are available but tend to be costly.

weather.description: Cold and quiet with occasional fog over the lake, but crisp clear days offer stunning alpine views.
Still cool with some rain, but early signs of spring begin to appear on the hillsides.
Mild and increasingly pleasant, with blooming gardens and fewer crowds than peak season.
Spring is in full swing with lush greenery, mild temperatures, and occasional afternoon showers.
Warm and beautiful, one of the best months to visit with flowers in bloom and comfortable temperatures.
Early summer brings warm sunny days ideal for boat trips and lakeside dining.
Hot and busy at peak season, with long sunny days perfect for swimming and outdoor activities.
Still hot and crowded, with occasional thunderstorms providing brief relief from the heat.
Warm and golden with thinning crowds, making it an excellent month for a more relaxed visit.
Autumn colours arrive on the hillsides and temperatures cool pleasantly, though rain becomes more frequent.
Noticeably cooler and wetter with many tourist facilities closing, but the lake retains a moody charm.
Cold and quiet with festive atmosphere in the towns, and occasional snow dusting the surrounding mountains.
